comments.text: Hi and welcome to RE.SE. SuRun is an open source application for a wide range of Windows versions and it does something similar. So you could inspect its source. It opens its settings dialog (or the prompt for credentials) on a separate desktop. This is meant to prevent other entities (such as certain window hooks) from having an effect. It's similar to the SAS desktop. But this doesn't appear to be about reverse engineering, does it?
